meanings.definition: A person who advocates thorough or complete political or social reform.
meanings.sent1: The radicals in the group organized a protest for social change.
meanings.sent2: The political radicals campaigned for new laws to help the community.
meanings.sent3: The radicals decided to throw a party to raise awareness about their cause.
meanings.sent4: Her bold ideas made her stand out as a radical among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the radicals marching with banners was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A group of atoms behaving as a unit in a number of compounds.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study how radicals interact with other atoms in compounds.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use radicals to understand the reactions between different elements.
meanings.sent3: The radicals in the chemical equation threw a surprise party for the elements.
meanings.sent4: The radicals bonded together like a strong team in the compound.
meanings.sent5: The explosive nature of radicals in reactions amazed the students.

meanings.definition: A root or base form of a word.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the radicals of words helps in learning new languages.
meanings.sent2: Teachers explain how radicals form the foundation of vocabulary.
meanings.sent3: The radicals of the language decided to start a book club.
meanings.sent4: Just like roots support trees, radicals support the meaning of words.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of radicals makes them essential in word construction.
